intro: Pithecellobium roseum var. glaucescens, commonly known as the glaucous rose pisonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3–5 meters. The plant features compound leaves with elliptical to ovate leaflets, and its flowers are usually pale pink to white, with showy, clustered inflorescences. It produces small, edible pods that contain several seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. The varietal name 'glaucescens' refers to the bluish-gray waxy coating on its young leaves and stems.
